intro: Uvaria angolensis, commonly known as the African star fruit or African guava, is a tropical shrub native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature, containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
